diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Serpiginous ganglion cyst of the foot
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a serpiginous lesion on the foot, initially interpreted as creeping eruption (larva migrans cutanea). However, clinical evaluation and histologic examination revealed a multilocular cyst consistent with a ganglion cyst, evidenced by the presence of mucoid material and collagen structures with no epithelial lining, leading to the final diagnosis.
